page.title: 12RECREATION
page.content: One of the amenities in Hythe is the Sailing Club. It is sited on Shore Road between the Scout Hut and the US Army base. It can accommodate boats from a few feet long up to about 30 feet long, any larger and the summer mooring wouldn't be able to take the strain. The moorings are divided into two sections. There are some out by the army barges and the rest are the other side of the army base, off Waitrose car park. There are two categories of mooring, those which dry out and those which don't. The smaller boats with lifting keels and bilge keels go on the mud, and the larger boats go on the deep moorings. In the winter the boats are kept in a pound. This has power points and a special hose for cleaning boats. There is a clubhouse which has a bar, galley and a changing room with showers.
